intro: Helianthopsis discolor, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its flowers are yellow with a white center, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Helianthopsis discolor is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
